intro: Calcitrapa sordida, commonly known as the sordid bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or dry soils. The plant produces bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Calcitrapa sordida is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
